intro: Cakile edentula var. millspaughii, commonly known as the Millspaugh's sea rocket, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along shorelines, tolerating salt spray and wind. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces yellow flowers in early spring. This variant is distinguished by its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations to coastal environments.
